_header: When the Flemings were fresh flourished in your flowers
Subjects: historical poems; Flemings, song against; chronicles, verse in
_description: Mocking song against the Flemings (A.D. 1436) — thirty-three couplets in eight irregular stanzas inserted in a prose Brut

Lam6.First Lines:
When þe flemynges were fressh flourisshid in your flouruisAnd
                    had weth at your will ye wolde be conquerouris…
Lam6.Last Lines:
…Ye be nothing elles worth but gret wordes to campSet ye still
                    and bith in pees god gyue you quadercamp
Lam6.Note:
At the end of St. Alban’s Chronicle, written two lines per
                    line of verse.
Lam6.Editions:

             “Satirical Rhymes of the Defeat of the Flemings.”

         33 (1849): 129-32: 130-2.
